alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 7:25PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Elbert and southern Lincoln Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 725 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northeast of Kutch to 5 miles southeast of Rush, or along a line extending from 15 miles south of Limon to 40 miles east of Colorado Springs. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kutch, Karval, Forder and Punkin Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
